intro: Hedysarum cornutum, commonly known as the horned vetch, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive, curved seed pods. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has trifoliate leaves with hairy surfaces. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, and it produces a unique horn-shaped fruit that aids in seed dispersal. Hedysarum cornutum is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to temperate climates.
